Previous: āñchNext: ār

√āp 'obtain'

present: [5.] āpnóti etc. AV.+  āpnute  

perfect: ā́pa  āpitha etc. V.+  āpiré  āpāná  

aorist: [1.] āpyāsam  āpi B.+   -- [2.] ā́pat etc. V.+  apeyam   -- [3.] āpipan  āpīpipat   -- [4.] āpsīs  

future: [1.] āpsyati B.+  āpsyate   -- [2.] āptā  

verbal: āptá V.+  ā́ptum B.+  āptvā́ B.+  -āpya B.+  

secondary: passive: āpyáte etc. B.+   -- desiderative: ī́psati etc. AV.+  īpsate etc.  aipsīt etc.   -- causative: āpayati etc. B.+  āpayate etc.  āpipayiṣet  

derivatives: -āpa B.+  -āpaka E.+  -āpin U.+  āpyà AV.+  āpana V.+  -āpanīya S.+  āpaneya U1.  āpí V.+  ā́pti AV.+  āptavya U.+  -āptṛ C.  ā́pnāna? RV.S.  -āpayitavya U.C.  āpayitṛ U.C.  īpsā E.+  -īpsin U.  īpsu S.+  āpipayiṣu E.  

To a more original form of the root (āp is perhaps ā + ap) doubtless belong also:

ápas V.  apás V.B.  ápnas  apna- RV.  -apta  

BR. regard apás at RV.iii.6.7 as a verb-form from this simpler root.
